rules: Rule1: Provided that a material scientist studies magma viscosity, a project advances eruption prediction.
Rule2: Either a material scientist studies magma viscosity or a geologist studies seismic activity.
Rule3: Whenever a peer reviewer revises a manuscript, a journal publishes a research paper.
Rule4: If a grant agency funds a field expedition, then it approves a budget.
Rule5: Provided that an eruption triggers an evacuation, a project advances eruption prediction.
Rule6: Whenever an eruption measures plume height, it triggers an evacuation.
Rule7: If a data team analyzes a false alarm, then authorities cancel an evacuation.
Rule8: Under the condition that a simulation uses a physics engine, a project advances eruption prediction.
Rule9: If a simulation models pyroclastic flow, then it uses a physics engine.
Rule10: If a dataset contains an anomaly, then it is not the case that the anomaly explains caldera formation.
Rule11: Either a dataset contains an anomaly or a project advances eruption prediction.
Rule12: Provided that a principal investigator verifies a dataset, if the dataset contains an anomaly, then the anomaly explains caldera formation.
Rule13: If a supercomputer runs a simulation, then a principal investigator verifies a dataset.
Rule14: Provided that a cluster runs a simulation, a principal investigator verifies a dataset.
Rule15: If a simulation requires high memory, then either a supercomputer runs it or a cluster runs it.
Rule16: Either a simulation requires high memory or it requires a fast processor.
Rule17: Provided that a simulation requires a fast processor, it requires GPU acceleration.
Rule18: If a team monitors magma pressure, then magma pressure reaches a critical level.
Rule19: Whenever a simulation requires GPU acceleration, a supercomputer runs it or a cluster runs it.
Rule20: Under the condition that a protocol activates data preservation, it activates an emergency response.

Rule21: Provided that a server handles data backup, if it is not the case that (if a team monitors magma pressure, then magma pressure does not reach a critical level), then a protocol activates data preservation.
Rule22: Either a server handles data backup or a workstation handles data backup.
Rule23: Whenever a sensor network deploys a gas monitor, a team does not monitor magma pressure.
Rule24: Provided that a backup system switches to cloud storage, it fails on local storage.
Rule25: Under the condition that results compare with a prediction, they match the prediction.
Rule26: Either results compare with a prediction or, if a paper cites prior work, then a journal publishes a research paper.
Rule27: Either a hypothesis accepts a steady state or it does not reject a steady state.
Rule28: Either a funder complies with open science or it violates open science.
Rule29: Under the condition that a funder violates open science, a repository does not charge an access fee.
Rule30: Provided that a committee audits compliance, if a funder complies with open science, then a repository provides open access.
Rule31: Either a committee audits compliance or it reviews compliance.
Rule32: If a committee reviews compliance, then, whenever a funder complies with open science, a repository provides open access.
Rule33: Whenever a researcher presents a conference paper, a journal publishes a research paper.
Rule34: Either a researcher presents a conference paper or a graduate student presents a conference paper.
Rule35: Either a conference streams online or, if it misses a keynote, then it attends a keynote.
Rule36: Under the condition that a simulation implements finite element, it uses a physics engine.
Rule37: Either a simulation implements finite element or it implements particle method.
Rule38: Provided that a sensor calibrates a gas monitor, if a sensor network does not deploy a gas monitor, then it does not deploy a seismometer.
Rule39: Either a sensor calibrates a gas monitor or it calibrates a seismometer.
Rule40: Provided that a simulation implements particle method, it couples thermodynamics.
Rule41: Under the condition that a simulation solves Navier-Stokes, it uses a physics engine.
Rule42: Provided that a simulation couples thermodynamics, it couples chemistry.
Rule43: If an operator restarts a simulation, then, given that it is not the case that (if a simulation couples chemistry, then it solves Navier-Stokes), the simulation crashes from instability.
Rule44: Provided that a script restarts a simulation, if it is not the case that (if a simulation couples chemistry, then it solves Navier-Stokes), the simulation crashes from instability.
Rule45: Under the condition that a system logs a restart event, an operator restarts a simulation or a script restarts a simulation.
Rule46: If a sensor calibrates a seismometer, then, provided that a sensor network does not deploy a gas monitor, it does not deploy a seismometer.

Rule47: Provided that a parameter adjusts viscosity, if it is not the case that (either an algorithm flags an outlier or, if a dataset contains an anomaly, then the anomaly explains caldera formation), then an algorithm does not correct an outlier.

Rule48: Under the condition that a parameter adjusts temperature, if it is not the case that (either an algorithm flags an outlier or, if a dataset contains an anomaly, then the anomaly explains caldera formation), then an algorithm does not correct an outlier.
Rule49: Either a parameter is based on a lab experiment or it is based on literature.
Rule50: Provided that a parameter is based on literature, it adjusts temperature.
Rule51: If a parameter set is archived in a database, then either it is documented in a lab notebook or, provided that a parameter is based on a lab experiment, it adjusts viscosity.
Rule52: Whenever a journal publishes a research paper, a project advances eruption prediction.

Rule53: If a result validates via a convergence test, then, given that it is not the case that (if it is not the case that (if a programmer debugs code, then, if code executes a simulation, a supercomputer runs it or a cluster runs it), then code does not fix a memory leak), code does not fix a race condition.
Rule54: Under the condition that a validation performs grid refinement, a result validates via a convergence test.
Rule55: Provided that a validation performs a time step study, a result validates via a convergence test.
Rule56: Either a validation passes acceptance criteria or a validation performs grid refinement or it performs a time step study.
Rule57: Whenever a validation fails acceptance criteria, a result approximates an analytical solution.
Rule58: Provided that a validation fails acceptance criteria, a result does not meet an accuracy standard.
Rule59: Provided that an advisor approves a result, if the result is reused for calibration, then it is not discarded for inaccuracy.
Rule60: Either an advisor approves a result or a committee approves a result.
Rule61: Either a lead researcher submits a manuscript or a peer reviewer revises a manuscript.
Rule62: If a committee approves a result, then, under the condition that the result is reused for calibration, it is not discarded for inaccuracy.

Rule63: If a theory is presented at a keynote, then, given that it is not the case that (if it is not the case that (if a theory proposes a new mechanism, then it explains an anomaly), then the theory challenges an established view), it revolutionizes a field.
Rule64: Either a theory is presented at a keynote or it is presented at a workshop.
Rule65: Whenever a theory is presented at a workshop, it sparks debate.

Rule66: If a theory garners attention, then, provided that it is not the case that (if it is not the case that (if a theory proposes a new mechanism, then it explains an anomaly), then the theory challenges an established view), it revolutionizes a field.
Rule67: Either a theory enters a textbook or, if a theory sparks debate, then it garners attention.
Rule68: If it is not the case that (if a geologist studies seismic activity, then a project advances eruption prediction), then a team monitors magma pressure.
Rule69: Provided that it is not the case that (if a geologist studies seismic activity, then a project advances eruption prediction), a system alerts about magma pressure.
Rule70: Whenever it is not the case that (if a dataset contains an anomaly, then the anomaly explains caldera formation), a theory proposes a new mechanism.
Rule71: Under the condition that it is not the case that (if a team monitors magma pressure, then magma pressure does not reach a critical level), a protocol does not activate an emergency response.
Rule72: If it is not the case that (if a system alerts about magma pressure, then magma pressure exceeds a threshold), then a system tests a backup protocol.
Rule73: Provided that it is not the case that (if a system alerts about magma pressure, then magma pressure exceeds a threshold), a system does not test a backup protocol.

Rule74: Under the condition that it is not the case that (if a workstation handles data backup, then, if it is not the case that (if a team monitors magma pressure, then magma pressure does not reach a critical level), a protocol activates data preservation), a backup system switches to cloud storage.
Rule75: Provided that it is not the case that (if results compare with a prediction, then they do not match the prediction), a hypothesis rejects a steady state.

Rule76: If it is not the case that (either a repository hosts raw data or, if a paper includes supplementary data, then, under the condition that a lead researcher submits a manuscript, a journal publishes a research paper), then a repository charges an access fee.
Rule77: Provided that it is not the case that (if a graduate student presents a conference paper, then a journal publishes a research paper), a conference misses a keynote.
Rule78: Under the condition that it is not the case that (if a graduate student presents a conference paper, then a journal publishes a research paper), a conference does not attend a keynote.
Rule79: Provided that it is not the case that (if a simulation couples chemistry, then it solves Navier-Stokes), the simulation does not crash from instability.
Rule80: Whenever it is not the case that (either an algorithm flags an outlier or, if a dataset contains an anomaly, then the anomaly explains caldera formation), an algorithm corrects an outlier.
Rule81: If it is not the case that (if a programmer debugs code, then, if code executes a simulation, a supercomputer runs it or a cluster runs it), then code fixes a memory leak.
Rule82: Whenever it is not the case that (if a result approximates an analytical solution, then it meets an accuracy standard), the result is discarded for inaccuracy.
Rule83: Under the condition that it is not the case that (if a result approximates an analytical solution, then it meets an accuracy standard), the result is reused for calibration.
Rule84: If it is not the case that (if a lead researcher submits a manuscript, then a journal publishes a research paper), then a grant agency funds a field expedition.
Rule85: Provided that it is not the case that (if a theory proposes a new mechanism, then it explains an anomaly), the theory does not challenge an established view.

Rule86: If it is not the case that (if it is not the case that (if a volcano has an eruption, then the eruption measures plume height), an observatory issues a false alarm), then a data team analyzes a false alarm.

Rule87: Provided that it is not the case that (if it is not the case that (if a programmer debugs code, then, if code executes a simulation, a supercomputer runs it or a cluster runs it), then code does not fix a memory leak), code fixes a race condition.
Rule88: Provided that it is not the case that (if a simulation does not model pyroclastic flow, then a model validates field data), a model disproves field data.
Rule89: Whenever a principal investigator does not verify a dataset, a validation fails acceptance criteria.
Rule90: If a sensor network does not deploy a gas monitor, then it deploys a seismometer.
facts: Fact1: A volcano has an eruption.
Fact2: A paper cites prior work.
Fact3: A paper includes supplementary data.
Fact4: A system logs a restart event.
Fact5: A parameter set is archived in a database.
Fact6: Code executes a simulation.
Fact7: A programmer debugs code.
Fact8: A grant agency does not approve a budget.
Fact9: An observatory does not issue a false alarm.
Fact10: Authorities do not cancel an evacuation.
Fact11: A model does not validate field data.
Fact12: A model does not disprove field data.
Fact13: Magma pressure does not exceed a threshold.
Fact14: A backup system does not fail on local storage.
Fact15: A hypothesis does not accept a steady state.
Fact16: A repository does not host raw data.
Fact17: A repository does not provide open access.
Fact18: A conference does not stream online.
Fact19: An algorithm does not flag an outlier.
Fact20: A parameter set is not documented in a lab notebook.
Fact21: A validation does not pass acceptance criteria.
Fact22: A theory does not explain an anomaly.
Fact23: A theory does not revolutionize a field.
Fact24: A theory does not enter a textbook.
